title: 110_hr2752
content: The Act may be cited as the "Market Incentives for Biobased Products Act of 2007". It includes findings related to biobased products. Congress finds significant potential for replacing petroleum-based products with farm-grown biomass, providing value-added opportunities for farmers and environmentally friendly options for consumers. The Federal Government can promote the biobased industry through procurement and a labeling program for biobased products to raise consumer awareness. This market development also encourages investment and employment opportunities in rural America by reducing petroleum use. By reducing petroleum use and increasing reliance on farm-grown raw materials, the Nation can decrease its need for imported petroleum. AMENDMENTS RELATING TO FEDERAL PROCUREMENT AND LABELING OF BIOBASED PRODUCTS. Amendments were made to the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 regarding procurement guidelines and labeling requirements for biobased products. The changes include adding information on life cycle costs if available and setting a revised deadline for labeling criteria issuance. Amendments to the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 include consultation with various groups for developing eligibility criteria for a labeling program for biobased products. Authorization of appropriations is also revised. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to authorize appropriations for implementing provisions related to federal procurement and labeling of biobased products. Funding for testing biobased products is increased for fiscal years 2008 through 2013. Report requirements for agencies are also outlined. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to require procuring agencies to submit annual reports to the Administrator for Federal Procurement Policy. Reports must cover actions taken to implement specific subsections, results of annual reviews, and the number of contracts involving biobased products. The Market Incentives for Biobased Products Act of 2007 amended the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 to require agencies to procure biobased products and submit annual reports to Congress on implementation. The reports must include a management plan for full implementation of the section. The Market Incentives for Biobased Products Act of 2007 amended the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 to require agencies to procure biobased products and submit annual reports to Congress on implementation, including milestones, funding allocations, and procurement preferences.
